title: When You're Barely Defending the Nexus and the Enemy Team says "Just Surrender"

replies.body: I hate it when they do that. Because then I can't surrender.  I must make them earn those hits on the nexus.

There was this Trist yesterday who said in all chat "I'm an 18/0 Trist, just surrender you're wasting my time" As you can see, we won that game and consistently focused Trist because like she said, she was 18 and 0 and instead of giving those kills to people she took all of them, making it really easy when she was dead to push.

18/0?!

{{champion:82}} *heavy breathing*
SIX V FOUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR!
http://25.media.tumblr.com/a259290d0c82cb7842ac8a8232b8b27f/tumblr_mic5phjYul1rmfhlho1_250.gif
This gif is... incredible.
omg, this is amazing, made me laugh  :)
{{champion:53}}: THE TIME OF MAN HAS COME TO AN END
{{champion:121}} it is THE time for change
change.... is GOOD.

I win 60% of my games by focusing on their carry as {{champion:89}}. Doesn't matter if you're the ADC, mid laner, jungler ... if you took the majority of kills and I stop you from getting anymore kills, my team has an easier time completing objectives. I also make my build around who's the most threatening / impactful towards my team.
Ok.....but what if they have more than one threat on the field?
The sun can focus everyone.

Then you're not praising hard enough!

Jokes aside, I can only do so much to stop 1 or more people from doing certain actions, but I can't hold them all on my own. The best thing I can hope for is my teammates making plays, following up before / after my engage. We all play a part and even if I did perfect ... my team has to either finish off the carry or eliminate anyone else that poses a threat.

Here's a good example:

I see their {{champion:222}} in the backline, trying to stay safe. Of course, her support {{champion:12}} is going ham on our frontline because he wants to fight. This is the perfect chance for me to go on their carry with a R + E + Q combo and then press W as she tries to auto me.

If my team was paying attention, because Alistar already did his combo on our frontline- they would immediately pile on their ADC and kill her since I stunned her for a good portion. Now it's a 4v5 with their best (or carry) gone, they're going to lack the damage to finish us all off. Of course, as a {{champion:89}} main, I usually try to R on multiple champions if they're grouped, and go on their carry so all their aggro turns to me. This allows my teammates to engage, likely survive, and complete objectives ... because even if I die, as long as I secured the kills / made their carry die, my team poses a greater chance of winning the game.

But now imagine if I went on Jinx, did everything right ... but my team is still focusing their entire CC / Ults / damage on Alistar? Suddenly I die for no reason, Alistar may die as well but now their team is going to shred mine because they still have their ults / spells / autos, ect.

What i'm trying to get at, is it's a team game. Pay attention to who's being CC'd and what you can do to shut down their carry / biggest player. By making smart plays and working together, you can win your games more often or have an easier chance at least.

Now it's a 4v5 with their best (or carry) gone, they're going to lack the damage to finish us all off. Of course, as a {{champion:89}} main, I usually try to R on multiple champions if they're grouped, and go on their carry so all their aggro turns to me. This allows my teammates to engage, likely survive, and complete objectives ... because even if I die, as long as I secured the kills / made their carry die, my team poses a greater chance of winning the game.
> 
> But now imagine if I went on Jinx, did everything right ... but my team is still focusing their entire CC / Ults / damage on Alistar? Suddenly I die for no reason, Alistar may die as well but now their team is going to shred mine because they still have their ults / spells / autos, ect.
> 
> What i'm trying to get at, is it's a team game. Pay attention to who's being CC'd and what you can do to shut down their carry / biggest player. By making smart plays and working together, you can win your games more often or have an easier chance at least.

Very well put.  Easier said then done a lot of times.  It's tough as a supp when you dive the enemy carry and get it all right just to have a team just stand there or blow ults as described.  Thats why I stopped running tank supps like Leona, Braum etc and started playing more mage supps like Morg.  I can control the fight more and depend less on follow up.  If I land a morg Q it's a free for all of throwing skittles at them.
''Then you're not praising hard enough.'' As a follower of the sun, I agree with you wholeheartedly. {{champion:89}}

On the other hand, not everyone on your team is Garen, Irelia, Aatrox, Xin. They will have to get past that Ali as well, on top of the 3 other people to get to the CCd Jinx. The teams ADC should probably be focusing that Ali IMO, and the mage, indiscriminate as long as he can get at least 1 rotation off multiple targets (for aoe mages). He can die after, his job is done.

But the issue is, you're already a danger to Jinx, their team has to respond if you're the main source of Cc because your combo will still last longer than Ali's. And if your W hit in the middle of your team, as long as they're smacking people they still get some bonus damage.
As someone who plays diving junglers or supports a lot I do my best to communicate to my silver teammates that I'll focus the carry. I do it my weaving "Focus Jinx" pings in between my abilities ;P
Literally just helped 110% thanks for the advice!

> [{quoted}](name=TsunamiWave22,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=u2XRWZQy,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-10-11T20:39:33.467+0000)

As an adc main, never point out you're the most fed on the team, thats just an garunteed death sentence. So that little twat of a trist got what she deserved.
dang, I guess next time I play adc I won't take the kills
SAME that's just how I feel! Im like no. I will NEVER SURRENDER NOW! I HAVE HOPE TO WIN! Then the yasuo gets a penta kill...{{champion:157}} {{item:3070}}
Never give up.  If they dare ask for an easy victory, then at least make them waste their so called precious time.
Nah man, Cc the Yasuo, they try to go for Squishies, but these are MY Squishies. {{champion:89}}  How can they complete the penta if they're not allowed to move?

I was playing One for All with a full team, we were fiddlesticks against blitzcrank. I'm pretty sure they got us down to our nexus (we may have still had the turrets), but we kept waveclearing and surviving until the enemy team finally surrendered because they got tired of playing

And then they throw and you win.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-rainbows}}

The hero my team does not deserve. But the hero my LP needs.

Come forth brothers and sisters! Today is a good day to die! Onwards! Death!!!!

http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/599/373/403.gif
That moment you somehow hard carry the match and feel like crying. Those hour long games, amiright?
http://stream1.gifsoup.com/view1/2286407/charge-o.gif

Had a ranked game yesterday where my team mates decided to engage 4v5 and give Vayne an unofficial Quadra Kill late game. They pushed all the way to our Nexus and instead of finishing they backed off b/c they wanted to pad their KDA's. I told my team to get behind me and follow me in on Vayne. Was Nasus {{item:3025}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3111}} {{item:3748}} {{item:3742}} and {{item:3075}}. We killed Vayne and collapsed on the rest of them and pushed to steal the win. 

Moral of the story never be cocky if you have the advantage and never pad your KDA. If you aren't playing to blow up the enemy nexus then you are playing to lose and yes never surrender...

Amen, brother dog. 
Personally, I prefer ZZ'Rot Portal over Dead Man's Plate, due to the zerglings.

LOL! ALL HAIL OUR LORD AND SAVIOR.... NASUS!!! But seriously I prefer ZZ-Rot too but I had to get rid of the component I was building for ZZ' Rot for  the Thorn mail, to kill Vayne and needed the move speed from Deadman's to catch up to fights and get to objectives before they could react.

I would rather make someone earn victory than concede defeat.  I'm here to play, win or lose.  Giving up just isn't a choice unless we're getting utterly pulverized, and if we are, then it won't be long anyway.  xD

https://media0.giphy.com/media/SXcgjAPQnWOhW/giphy.gif

Never give in. Never give up.

http://imgur.com/gallery/yQEzVS1

Proceed to kick ass!
Couldn't find a gif for the ankle grab :c
That reminds me there is a new Avenger movie I have yet to watch.

> \*Is upvoted for not watching newest Avenger movie yet.\*

BLASPHEME!!!
Hey, not my fault I have 300 TV channels and nothing to watch, so I don't get to see all those movie trailers and shit.
I don't think telling the enemy team to surrender has ever once led to a surrender, in the history of league. Super counterproductive thing to type out.

Had one of those games yesterday.

All three inhibitors down. Enemy had baron _and_ elder dragon. We made them fight to finish.

Spoilers: we won.

On the other end of one of those games today.

Enemy Nexus Turrets down
3 Members of enemy team down
One laner and I in enemy base
We got the nexus down to 150 before they dropped me
They ended up winning
This is why I mute the enemy team, much better without them being toxic.

Not just defending the Nexus: 

* Defending the Nexus being the only one alive 
* Trying to outplay and maneuver a three man gank while hiding behind the Top lane turret
* Slowly getting your lane stomped 
* Trying to fight the fed Vayne that dive rolls you after second

A while back, I got autofilled as support, and played Janna for the first time (It was normals, relax people). Two people on our team went AFK. It was me, Syndra and Kha'Zix versus the world. Kha'Zix got a Pentakill and we won.

Never surrender. Never give up.

I once had our jg AFK after forcing me {{champion:14}} and the Adc {{champion:236}}  to take smite, our support took {{summoner:3}}  {{summoner:7}} We ended up winning that 4v5, taking multiple dragons, farming for buffs, and taking the win without the surrender vote.

The meme shows a feeling that we go through yes, but - if we aren't attentive to what matches with our team's wish, then even if we are that guy who holds out to the last, we are still selfish and completely defeat the noble purpose of being bold and enduring.

But you look more like this :P

https://media3.popsugar-assets.com/files/2016/05/05/880/n/1922398/2807a7b0f32ac31f_i_can_do_this_all_day.xxxlarge.gif
